title: `'static` lifetime requirement on generic in order for container type to implement `'static` when using `PhantomData`

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::marker::PhantomData;

struct Marker<T>(PhantomData<T>);

fn assert_static_marker<T>(marker: Marker<T>) {
    assert_static(marker)
}
fn assert_static<O: 'static>(_o: O) {}

```

I expected the code to compile without any errors, since `Marker` doesn't really hold a `T`, so it doesn't matter if `T` is `'static` or not for `Marker` to be `'static`.

Instead, i got a compilation error:
```
error[E0310]: the parameter type `T` may not live long enough
 --> src/main.rs:9:5
  |
9 |     assert_static(marker)
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ...so that the type `T` will meet its required lifetime bounds
  |
help: consider adding an explicit lifetime bound...
  |
8 | fn assert_static_marker<T: 'static>(marker: Marker<T>) {
  |                          +++++++++

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0310`.
```
